title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2014 Zinnkoepflé Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Baked apple freshness on the nose segues into a tart, spicy but dry palate. There are peppery edges around tart, crisp green and red-apple fruit. This has an immensely refreshing, lip-smacking core of untamed freshness and thus provides lots of excitement. Not for the faint-hearted, more like a few rounds on a racetrack at breakneck speed. Very invigorating and long.

title: Dr. Bürklin-Wolf 2014 Wachenheimer Goldbächel P.C. Dry Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Slicks of candle wax and blossomy perfume meld with synergy in this zesty, dry Riesling. The palate is crisp and tart, accented by green melon and lime flavors, but augmented by a distinctly honeyed richness. Drink now through 2025.

title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Spine-tingling acidity cuts a fine edge through this buoyantly fruity but nuanced wine. The palate is lip-smackingly sweet-tart, bursting of ripe raspberry and yellow cherry flavors that stretch out a long, spicy finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Bold, penetrating yellow-cherry and pink grapefruit flavors are calibrated by streaks of lime, lemon and slate in this invigorating kabinett. Kicks of saffron and spice accentuate its pert, racy style. Enjoy now through 2018 for fresh, fruity refreshment.

title: Ayoub 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Six clones are blended into this wine, an elegant and aromatic style of Pinot Noir. With breathing time it adds volume, showing more heft and complexity. The pretty red fruits are set in a frame that shows more minerality than tannin.

title: Ayoub 2013 ??? Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The ??? Pinot from Ayoub is a true mystery wine, made with fruit sourced from unnameable but exceptionally high-end sources. Flavors are subtle and elegant, with lovely floral top notes over firm, well-balanced fruit and chewy tannins. Still quite young and compact, this wine needs another five years at a minimum to blossom. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Ayoub 2014 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: Mostly Thistle fruit, with some Hyland also, this is a blend of lots aged in one stainless barrel, one Champagne barrel, and the rest neutral. The mix works well, crafting a well-defined wine with some chicken-stock flavors modulating strands of lime, citrus and apple. It finishes with light toast and impressive length.

title: Vila da Fonte 2013 Reserva Old Vines Red (Douro)
description: The old vines do their work and produce a highly concentrated wine. It has a dusty tannic structure, the tannins held in suspension surrounded by ripe black plum flavors. The oak aging adds to the richness of this fine, balanced wine that will age for several years. Drink from 2018.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2013 Eichberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Rounded, ripe notes of fresh and stewed pear sweeten nose and palate against a fine backbone of bright lemony acidity. There is the slightest nutty touch adding texture to that fruity freshness which leaves the palate just off-dry.

title: Cantina Terlano 2013 Vorberg Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige Terlano)
description: Full-bodied and loaded with finesse, this wine opens with multifaceted aromas of ripe orchard fruit, candied citrus zest, pressed flower and mineral tones. The focused, elegant palate offers ripe apple, pear, tangy nectarine, lemon drop and flint. While enjoyable now, this will drink well through 2023.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2013 Herdade de São Miguel Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This is a serious, structured wine with a great future. It has weight, tarry black tannins and dense berry fruits. Spice, toast and ripe fruitiness are all melding well together, although they need time. This complex, concentrated wine will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Casado Morales 2009 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: This is textbook Rioja gran reserva from a ripe, generous year. Aromas of cassis and prune blend with toasty, creamy oak. Fresh acidity is a lifesaver, because the tannins and oak level are up there. Flavors of tobacco, currant, vanilla and red plum end with a reprise of crisp acids and oak. This will last another 20 years before any fading comes into play.

title: Château Bouscaut 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich in black currant flavors that are shot through with strong toast notes followed by spice. That gives a dry wine, although one with good fruit weight. There is a strong sense of freshness at the end.

title: Château Deyrem Valentin 2015 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine is all about swathes of black and red fruit that are nicely sustained by dusty tannins. It has a really fresh character that is not contradicted by the dry core.

title: Château Faizeau 2015 Barrel Sample  (Montagne-Saint-Émilion)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Well structured and smooth in tannin, this is a ripe and smoky wine. It is full of rich, juicy acidity that complements swathes of black currant fruits. The wine is fresh yet still rich at the end.

title: Bodegas Landaluce 2009 Capricho  (Rioja)
description: Dark, alluring aromas of licorice, blackberry and toast share space with earthy, mossy notes on the nose of this full-bodied winner that's showing wall-to-wall weight and tannins. Black plum, cassis and tobacco flavors are a common Rioja trifecta, as are dry, peppery, figgy flavors on the finish. Drink from 2018–2028.

title: Château Lynch-Moussas 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a smooth, polished and ripe wine. The tannins are in the background, allowing blackberry fruits to dominate. The wine is going to develop quickly.

title: Château Pavie 2015 Arômes de Pavie Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. Spicy and ripe, this wine has a strong structure of brooding tannins. There are also great black plum and blackberry flavors here that are super-ripe.

title: Dante Robere 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Dense, saturated aromas and flavors blend ripe fruit with ample oaky spices to form a mouthcoating layer of goodness. This wine is medium bodied, but almost swaggering in style, and delicious. It has lots of firm tannins but the tempting flavors soften the texture and make it fun to drink.

title: Buena Vista 2013 Ida's Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light in color and crisp in style, this wine nicely combines all the lovable features of the variety, from barnyard-like earth at its core, to streaks of cinnamon, cranberry and red cherry. It finishes with length and breadth, never getting bogged down in too much oak or tannin.

title: Shea 2013 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The Pommard clone gives a distinctive taste of breakfast tea to the wine, with fresh raspberry fruit and a lick of lemon. It's nicely astringent but smooth and well structured, with light touches of frangipane.

title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2013 Heritage Clones Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The heritage clones referenced here are Pommard and Wädenswil, yielding fresh and forward fruit flavors of strawberry with a cherry-popsickle kick. There's a nice brambly texture to the fruit, along with a dash of cola. It's a harmonious and texturally resonant Pinot Noir ready for near-term enjoyment.

title: Château Gloria 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. New wood flavors give a dry toast character to this wine. Its fruitiness takes a while to show through the dry exterior. It does have the weight to sustain the wood as it develops.

title: Château Haut-Brion 2015 La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This second wine comes from both La Mission Haut-Brion and Haut-Brion white parcels. This is a fine and ripe while also showing an herbal character. Citrus and yellow fruits work in harmony.
designation: La Clarté de Haut-Brion Barrel Sample

title: Château la Fleur de Boüard 2015 Barrel Sample  (Lalande de Pomerol)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This is a light, fragrant wine. Its tannins are well balanced with bright acidity and lively black currant fruits. The acidity is infectious, crisp and welcome.

title: Château la Gurgue 2015 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 91–93. Barrel Sample. This wine offers fine fruit characteristics and plenty of acidity. It has structure while also reveling in attractive black-currant flavors. The wine is already balanced and will develop well.

title: Viña Cobos 2012 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Concentrated and woody smelling, this ripe Cabernet is cut from the modern mold, meaning it's weighty and fully oaked. As for mouthfeel, expect severe tannins but also cuddly depth. Flavors of roasted, earthy berry fruits and cassis finish with oaky flavors of cocoa and mocha as well as herbal notes. Drink this integrated Cab through 2021.

title: Walt 2013 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a Green Valley site, this is a gorgeously grown and made wine. Baked apple and confectionary lemon verbena wrap around a brightness of acidity and richer dollops of oak and hazelnut. Full bodied, the wine remains crisp on the tongue, and will shine further as it opens in the glass and in the bottle.

title: Walt 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy raspberry surrounds a heft of oak and body, the wine rich and luxuriously full bodied. Seamless tannins make it easier to enjoy, the palate intensely layered and concentrated, with jolts of cinnamon spice on the finish.

title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2011 Single Vineyard Las Compuertas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Concentrated blackberry and prune aromas are wrapped in a blanket of chocolaty oak. Side-to-side jamminess and beefy tannins make for a full-force mouthfeel, while minty blackberry flavors end plush but with focus. Herbal notes of rosemary, thyme and mint add complexity. Drink through 2024.
